definition: to become sworn brothers or sisters/sworn (brothers)
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

sentences.english: We were blood brothers - I was ready to die for him.
sentences.chinese: 我们是滴血结拜的兄弟，我甚至可以为他而死。

sentences.english: Xiao Zhang and Xiao Wang became sworn brothers because of their affection.
sentences.chinese: 小张和小王因为感情好而结拜为异姓兄弟。

sentences.english: Blade suddenly proposed several times should be forced to complete the dedication to become sworn midfix.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋忽然间提议应将几次被迫中缀的结拜之礼完成。

sentences.english: Lin Chong and Lu Zhishen were sworn brothers.
sentences.chinese: 林冲和鲁智深是结拜兄弟。

sentences.english: Later, they decided to be sworn brothers and became more intimate than before .
sentences.chinese: 后来，两人结拜为兄弟，更是时时刻刻，形影不离。

sentences.english: Now we are Brothers Three, said the Pilgrim boy.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们是结拜三兄弟了，朝圣者男孩说。

sentences.english: According to an early tradition became his sworn brother.
sentences.chinese: 根据一条过去的传统，他成为他的结拜兄弟。

definition: to smear the lips with blood when taking an oath (idiom)/to swear a sacred oath
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
To enjoy blessings and endure misfortune together (idiom); for better or for worse
pinyin: you3 fu2 tong2 xiang3 , you3 nan4 tong2 dang1

definition: to make a pact of brotherhood (from “Romance of the Three Kingdoms” 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4]) (idiom)
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
